Message.TypeName: Provide correct arguments to formatting methods
Message.Issue: Method 'DB_Gets.GetAllProjectIssues(string)' calls 'string.Format(string, object)' and does not provide an argument for format item "{1}". The provided format string is: '"No issues, belonging to project {1}, were found."'

Message.Issue: Method 'DB_Gets.GetCommentByIssue(string, int)' calls 'string.Format(string, object, object)' and does not provide an argument for format item "{2}". The provided format string is: '"The comments, belonging to project {1} issue {2}, were not found."'

Method 'DB_Gets.GetCommentByIssue(string, int)' calls 'string.Format(string, object, object)' and does not provide a format item for argument "1". The provided format string is: '"The comments, belonging to project {1} issue {2}, were not found."'

'DB_Gets.SearchProjectIssues(string, string, int, int)' rethrows a caught exception and specifies it explicitly as an argument. Use 'throw' without an argument instead, in order to preserve the stack location where the exception was initially raised.
Add [Serializable] to 'MyException' as this type implements ISerializable.

Rule.Name: Mark ISerializable types with SerializableAttribute
Rule.Description: The System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable interface allows the type to customize its serialization, while the Serializable attribute enables the runtime to recognize the type as being serializable.
Rule.Resolution: Add [Serializable] to {0} as this type implements ISerializable.

Rule.TypeName: Provide correct arguments to formatting methods
Rule.Name: Provide correct arguments to formatting methods
Rule.Description: Provide the correct number of arguments to String.Format calls.
Rule.Resolution: Method {0} calls {1} and does not provide an argument for format item {2}. The provided format string is: '{3}'
Method {0} calls {1} and does not provide a format item for argument {2}. The provided format string is: '{3}'

Rule.Name: Rethrow to preserve stack details
Rule.Description: Use the IL rethrow instruction to preserve original stack details when re-raising a caught exception.
Rule.Resolution: {0} rethrows a caught exception and specifies it explicitly as an argument. Use 'throw' without an argument instead, in order to preserve the stack location where the exception was initially raised.
